SEARCH
Package io.github.thatgarlicdude.pacio.file

Class PacFile

java.lang.Object
io.github.thatgarlicdude.pacio.file.PacObject
io.github.thatgarlicdude.pacio.file.PacFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Loadable, Savable
public final class PacFile extends PacObject implements Loadable, Savable
A class that represents a file in a file system.

This class extends from PacObject, keeping its file path variable and the methods related to it. But because this class is treated like a regular file in the file system, it features new variables and methods that are unique to it and is related to files in the system's disk.

Most notably, this class features the byte array called data. It acts like the file's bytes from the system's disk, and can be loaded to memory using open() and saved back to the system's disk using save(). Additionally, it can be read by calling the read(int), read(int, int), and readAll() methods. Lastly, it can be written by calling the write(int, byte) and write(int, byte[]) methods.

PacFile also features the from methods, from(Path), from(URI), and from(String). Those methods are used to automatically open the PacFile without needing to write extra lines of code.

  • Constructor Details

    • PacFile

      public PacFile(Path path)
      Creates a new PacFile using a file path.

      This does not automatically open the PacFile when created. If the PacFile is created and needs to be opened, calling open() from the object will do the trick.

      The sole parameter, path, cannot be null. Otherwise, it will throw the IllegalArgumentException if this happens.

      Parameters:
      path - the file path to the file object in the system's disk.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if path is null.

  • Method Details

    • open

      public final void open() throws IOException
      Opens the file from the system's disk.

      This will load the bytes inside the file to the class's byte data, data. It can only work if the class's PacObject.path is valid. Otherwise, it will throw the IOException.

      Specified by:
      open in interface Loadable
      Specified by:
      open in class PacObject
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading from disk fails.

    • close

      public final void close()
      Closes the file, freeing its data from memory.

      When this method is called, it will clear every byte from data with zeroes, and then nullify the array, clearing it from memory.

      Specified by:
      close in interface Loadable
      Specified by:
      close in class PacObject

    • save

      public final void save() throws IOException
      Saves the file from the system's disk by overwriting it with the contents from data.

      This method only works when the PacObject.path is valid. Otherwise, it will throw the IOException instead.

      Specified by:
      save in interface Savable
      Specified by:
      save in class PacObject
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing from disk fails.

    • read

      public final byte read(int offset)
      Reads a single byte in the class's data.

      If the offset is out of bounds, it will return 0 instead.

      Parameters:
      offset - the index for the class's data.
      Returns:
      the byte that was read from data.

    • read

      public final byte[] read(int offset, int size)
      Reads multiple bytes in the class's data.

      Like read(int), it will return 0 if the offset is out of bounds. The same happens when the size is not within the boundaries of data.

      Parameters:
      offset - the index for the class's data.
      size - the amount of bytes that will be read.
      Returns:
      the bytes that were read from data.

    • readAll

      public final byte[] readAll()
      Reads all the bytes in the class's data.

      This does not return the pointer of the data, but rather returns a copy of it. This was done for safety reasons, as no program should tamper this variable.

      Returns:
      the bytes that were read from data.

    • write

      public final void write(int offset, byte b)
      Writes a single byte in the class's data.

      If the offset is out of bounds, it will not do anything, and continue like normal. The data won't be affected if this happens.

      Parameters:
      offset - the index for the class's data.
      b - the byte that will get written in data.

    • write

      public final void write(int offset, byte[] bytes)
      Writes multiple bytes in the class's data.

      Like write(int, byte), it will not do anything if offset is out of bounds. This also happens when the method tries to write bytes outside of data.

      Parameters:
      offset - the index for the class's data.
      bytes - the bytes that will be written to data.

    • from

      public static PacFile from(Path path) throws IOException
      Creates a new PacFile using a file path, and automatically opens it to memory.
      Parameters:
      path - the file path to the file in the system's disk.
      Returns:
      a PacFile that's automatically opened.
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading from disk fails.
